title: Football news: Liverpool's James Milner proved the man for big occasion against Leicester
text:
James Milner proved himself to be the man for the big occasion once again as Liverpool consolidated their position at the top of table.

His nerveless injury time penalty – coupled with an outstanding pass to set up Sadio Mane’s opening goal – defined him as Liverpool’s most important player against Leicester but his performance once again led supporters to wonder about his future.

Milner’s contract runs out at the end of the season but he will be free to talk to foreign clubs in 85 days; Liverpool have yet to open formal talks about extending his stay at Anfield, which seems curious given his continued influence on and off the pitch.

James Milner scored a late winning penalty for Liverpool against Leicester on Saturday

The midfielder showed nerves of steel to send the ball past Kasper Schmeichel

Liverpool’s success rate with Bosman transfers has been hit and miss but Milner is certainly in the same bracket as Gary McAllister and Markus Babbel in terms of being a success and Brendan Rodgers, Leicester’s manager, told the story of how the 33-year-old ended up on Merseyside.

One of Rodgers’ final acts as Liverpool manager was secure Milner’s signature following his release from Manchester City and he recalled the night he drove to Cheshire to make his pitch; the Irishman only got to work with Milner for three months in 2015 but he knew he would be a success.

‘At that time, we felt that we needed that experience to come in,’ said Rodgers. ‘It was a big decision for James. I remember travelling out one evening with Charlotte, my wife, and we were trying to coax him to come. So we went to his house and we sat down.

Milner once again proved he is the man for the big occasion with his goal on Saturday

‘Charlotte did the work on his wife, telling her what a great club Liverpool is and how it is an incredible place to come. And I went to work on James… It’s really, really interesting because he wanted to come to Liverpool. He had won the Premier League, he had won cups.

‘His whole ambition was to win the Champions League and he felt he’d have a better opportunity to win it at Liverpool, with how we were working and the (history of the) club. He made the decision. I knew it was going to be a tough one. He was building a house out that way in Manchester.

‘When we got the call to say he was going to come, I was so, so happy. His professionalism, his intensity, his focus. It was always going to help the squad. Even though it was only a short time we worked together, he was always going to be a really good signing. He is just a top class professional.’

Brendan Rodgers also explained how he ended up bringing the 33-year-old to Anfield

It was noticeable at the final whistle that Rodgers put his disappointment at losing in such a manner to one side and made a beeline for Milner and Jordan Henderson to give the both a hug; he was well-regarded and respected by both midfielders at Anfield and the feeling was mutual.

‘I always try to do my best for the players – the likes of him, Jordan,’ said Rodgers. ‘When they lifted the European Cup last year, to see their joy and their happiness. It was absolutely brilliant. They are good guys and you are playing here under big pressure.

‘They are absolutely key for the whole spirit of Liverpool. They bring that intensity and focus and they are good guys.’
description: James Milner proved himself to be the man for the big occasion once again as Liverpool consolidated their position at the top of table. He scored a winning penalty in injury time.
authors: Dominic King For The Daily Mail
